description: Surrogate primary key for the warranty task record.
Audit timestamp of the latest insert/update to this record (UTC, yyyymmddHHMMSSmmm).
Indicates whether the warranty coverage or task window has expired.
Overall due date when this warranty task becomes due; may represent the next applicable trigger date. Sentinel values can indicate not set; confirm with SME.
Short business description of the warranty task.
Free-form notes or instructions related to the warranty task.
Remaining meter units (e.g., miles/hours) before the task is due.
Number of calendar days remaining until the task is due or warranty window closes.
Likely stores scan/barcode/diagnostic data associated with the task; confirm with SME.
Serialized schedule definition (XML) describing time/meter triggers for the task.
Identifier of the specific task/procedure to be performed under warranty.
Reference entity/table for the task identifier (e.g., which module stores the task); used with task.
Identifier of the asset or component to which this warranty task applies.
Entity/table name of the referenced item (e.g., equipment, part detail).
Unit of measure for the governing meter (e.g., miles, hours, kilometers).
Identifier of this record in the legacy source system for cross-reference.
Legacy source table name corresponding to legacykey.
Time unit for the elapsed-time rule used by the scheduler (e.g., Days, Months, Years).
Scheduler rule type code determining due logic (e.g., meter-based, time-based, or both); confirm code set with SME.
Code indicating when the warranty period begins (e.g., purchase or in-service date).
Option code selecting the schedule template/category (e.g., preventive maintenance); confirm code meanings with SME.
Numeric elapsed-time threshold used with the elapsed_time_type to compute due dates.
Threshold value for the fourth meter channel that can trigger the task; sentinel values may indicate not used.
Threshold value for the third meter channel that can trigger the task; sentinel values may indicate not used.
Threshold value for the second meter channel that can trigger the task; sentinel values may indicate not used.
Threshold value for the primary meter channel that can trigger the task.
Count for a secondary trigger rule (e.g., number of activations or remaining triggers); confirm behavior with SME.
Indicates whether the task is inactive and should not be scheduled.
If true, seasonal usage adjustments are ignored when projecting due dates from meter trends.
Estimated days remaining until due based on meter usage projections.
Meter reading at which the task becomes due for meter channel 4.
Meter reading at which the task becomes due for meter channel 3.
Meter reading at which the task becomes due for meter channel 2.
Meter reading at which the task becomes due for the primary meter.
Most recent recorded reading for meter channel 4 used in due calculations.
Most recent recorded reading for meter channel 3 used in due calculations.
Most recent recorded reading for meter channel 2 used in due calculations.
Most recent recorded reading for the primary meter used in due calculations.
Projected calendar date when the meter-based threshold is expected to be reached; blank if unknown.
Next due date derived from elapsed-time rules only.
Date the task was last performed or last triggered, used to calculate next due.
